tweets.text: RT @MikaelThalen: The journalism collective DDoSecrets has launched a new public data server that hosts 17 TB of data from over 100 leaked…

one huge commonality is escalation; a steady increase of cruelty that build until the unthinkable happens. I've previously documented the common story of numerous civilian complaints before an officer kills; shooters cruel to their girlfriends/mothers before shooting classmates

the vast majority of mass shooters, and a sickening number of police officers have a history of domestic violence– the causes of those things, and what draws those men towards guns is much closer to the place where leverage can be applied for meaningful change, imo
the problems of mass shootings and the obvious failings of modern policing cannot be separated; they are different features of the same beast, and the solutions to both will be upstream in society
RT @jppullen: EJ is an absolute joy to work with. Absolutely take him up on this, if you're in the market for exceptional visualization.
@jppullen ❣️Thank you!

@filrakowski the software acts like it cares about me, the human, and there are little spots of joy, inspired emoji-use is telltale (this is not a method of good DX, but usually coincides with a joy-driven approach) – overall, joy-driven, not output-driven or scale-driven

I’ve assembled a small team of incredible data / visualization folks– if you have an interesting dataset / problem to solve, we are looking to book a medium-to-large projects this spring. Get in touch: ejfox@ejfox.com
